result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory K. Meyer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Gregory K. Meyer
Current: 113 S. 2nd Ave., Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 10-05-2015)
Prior: 28 N. Brown Street #216, Rhinelander, WI 54501

10:05 a.m. Attorney John E Voorhees in court. Defendant does not appear. Steven Michlig, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 15CM185, 15CM259, 15FO521. Voorhees statement to defendant's non-appearance--defendant discharged from St. Mary's on Friday; he may not have housing--Voorhees believes he may be at Salvation Army in Wausau. Michlig requests warrant. Court authorizes warrant as previously ordered. 10:28 a.m. back on record. Counsel present, defendant now appears. Plea questionnaire & waiver filed. Voorhees speaks to agreement. State moves to dismiss 15CM183 but read in; granted by the Court. State moves to dismiss 15FO521; granted by the Court. Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1 in 15CM185 and Ct. 1 in 15CM259. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Voorhees/Court statement to sentencing. The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4). Warrants quashed, not yet issued.

01:38 pm - Attorney John E Voorhees in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15fo521, 15cm259 (initial)  and 15cm183 (PTC) and 15cm185 (PTC).  Voorhees provides letter requesting continuance.  Defendant is currently traveling the upper midwest with a carnival.    State does not object to an adjournment of the initial appearance and pretrials.  Bail continued in 15cm183 and 15cm185.  Adjourned 01:44 p.m.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

no intoxicants, no taverns, may not be Trig's and/or Walmart premises, may not possess on person immediate possession of firearm and/or knife.

02:30 pm - Defendant Gregory K. Meyer in court, via video,  with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Gregory K. Meyer in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea.  Bednar/Voorhees to bond.
